result.execSummary:
The defendant Mark A Topness was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Mark A Topness is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges. On one or more other charges, Mark A Topness was found not guilty. These charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Mark A Topness is presumed innocent of the not guilty charges.

  • Mark A Topness was found guilty of Attempt Escape-Criminal Arrest [Modifiers: Repeater], a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 946.42(3)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Take all prescribed medications as directed

Pay Crime Lab and Drug Assessment fee (see 'other' above for amount)

Pay DOC Supervision fees

If extended supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of resititution victims and/or govermental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt

THE CONVICTION ON CT 3 SHALL REMAIN BUT PARTIES JOINTLY RECOMMEND JOC BE AMENDED AS TO CT 3 TO ONE YEAR CJ WITH SENTENCE CREDIT THROUGH 9-7-17 (358 DAYS) PER STIPULATION OF PARTIES AND ORDER OF THE COURT
.
